transcript_chunks.text: you are the lead reviewer at kinda funny on Starfield what did you give it on our five-point scale I gave Starfield a 4 out of 5. okay explain the sense of Discovery the amount of things that you can do in this game is what makes it great if not the best game that Bethesda has made it is definitely right up there at the top as an RPG it does a lot of things very well there's some things not so much what holds it back from being a five the inventory system not great no that needs to be refined it needs a complete overhaul the game also suffers I think just from a narration and UI standpoint of pointing you in the direction of where to go and things to do like simple things like where do I go get ammo why isn't there a local map thank you planets the cities I'm in I just need to know what stores to get exactly but this is a game that you want to play you will want to immerse yourself in but that's the beauty of Starfield is it's your journey you get to do what you want to do when you

stores to get exactly but this is a game that you want to play you will want to immerse yourself in but that's the beauty of Starfield is it's your journey you get to do what you want to do when you play this is a game that you will go get an Xbox for
